newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela CANTV sees April rate hike on track.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela CANTV sees April rate hike on track.

text.p: Venezuelan national telephone company CANTV sees quarterly rate increases taking effect in April as scheduled, company President Gustavo Roosen said in a conference call with investors.
"The (communications) minister recently confirmed that in a local television interview," Roosen said.
Roosen added he was not negotiating for a change in the current quarterly rate adjustment formula to semi-annual adjustments.
But he said: "Under the concession agreement, tariffs can be looked at in 1997 ... and we are looking into local long- distance and international call (tariffs)."

CANTV rate adjustments are made each quarter taking into account lagged inflation. Although that produces real decreases as inflation accelerates -- and increases as inflation falls -- "the tariff system has worked well," said Andres Glusky, executive vice-president of finances.
"We received tariff increases of 88 percent in 1996, while inflation reached 103 percent."
